bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 23, 1940

div1.p: Truby hopes to have Hench's comments on his manuscript by January 15, 1941. He would like to hear about the Washington and Jefferson College memorial events.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 23, 1940

opener.dateline:
ALBERT E. TRUBY
145 LAUREL STREET
SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
Dec. 23/40

div1.p:
Your letter of the 21st has
just arrived and I hasten to
tell you to hold my story until
you have time to go over it
again and make the comments
and ask questions that occur
to you. I shall appreciate them
for you now have a very good
picture of what went on in Cuba
in 1900- My whole aim is
to get all the real facts so
that when I rewrite the M M S. it
will be as nearly correct as I
can possibly make it, after 40
years- If you will return it
so that I can have it by Jan. 15th
I will then be ready to work on
it again. After making a few
additions and corrections I am
going to send it on to Gen. Ireland
and others. Sometime in the spring
I will re-write it at my leisure
and hope to be able to do a much
better job and also to have it
nicely typed.

[I am much ashamed of the first
[rough draft which you now have.

With best wishes for a Merry
Christmas to you and your family
div1.closer:
Very Sincerely Yours Albert E. Truby.
P. S. when you write please tell
me about the W. & J. ceremonies
